displaytype="text"><textcomponent textrows="2" textwidth="300"><material><mattext>identifies the intended recipient</mattext></material></textcomponent></component><component ident="3" movable="no" snappable="yes" displaytype="text"><textcomponent textrows="2" textwidth="300"><material><mattext>value equal to or greater than 0x0600 indicates the encapsulated protocol synchronization between the sending and receiving devices</mattext></material></textcomponent></component><component ident="5" movable="no" snappable="yes" displaytype="text"><textcomponent textrows="2" textwidth="300"><material><mattext>used to detect errors in a frame</mattext></material></textcomponent></component><component ident="6" movable="no" snappable="yes" ai.question: What is a primary function of CSMA/CD in an Ethernet network?

choice.text: defines the area in which collisions can occur
identifies the start and end of Ethernet frame
provides a method to determine when and how hosts access the Ethernet medium
creates the header in the Ethernet frame as data is encapsulated
maps an IP address to a MAC address

ai.question: What technology is the IEEE 802.3ac standard specifically designed to accommodate?
What is the purpose of media access control?

choice.text: It identifies which workstation has sent a frame.
It determines which Layer 3 protocol should handle a frame.
It identifies which Ethernet frame format to use on the network.
It determines which workstation on a shared medium LAN is allowed to transmit data.

ai.question: How are collisions detected on an Ethernet network?

choice.text: Stations identify the altered FCS field on the colliding packets.
The signal amplitude on the networking media is higher than normal.
Traffic on the network cannot be detected due to a blockage
The signal amplitude on the networking media is lower than normal.

ai.question: Which Layer 2 sublayer provides services to the network layer of the OSI Model?
Which devices shown in the graphic must have a MAC address?
In the graphic, Host A has reached 50% completion in sending a 1 KB Ethernet frame to Host D when Host B wishes to transmit its own frame to Host C. What must Host B do?

choice.text: Host B can transmit immediately since it is connected on its own cable segment.
Host B must wait to receive a CSMA transmission from the hub, to signal its turn.
Host B must send a request signal to Host A by transmitting an interframe gap.
Host B must wait until it is certain that Host A has completed sending its frame.

ai.question: Which of the following are fields in an 802.3 Ethernet frame? (Choose three.)
What address type does a switch use to make selective forwarding decisions?
